solution_line_template: He shucks 10 oysters in {minutes_per_shuck_unit} minutes we need to know how many {minutes_per_shuck_unit} minute units are in {minutes_per_hour} minutes so {minutes_per_hour}/{minutes_per_shuck_unit} = <<{minutes_per_hour}/{minutes_per_shuck_unit}={five_minute_units_per_hour}>>{five_minute_units_per_hour} units

He can shuck {oysters_in_5_minutes} oysters in 5 minutes and there are {five_minute_units_per_hour} 5 minute units in an hour so he can shuck {oysters_in_5_minutes}*{five_minute_units_per_hour} = <<{oysters_in_5_minutes}*{five_minute_units_per_hour}={oysters_per_hour}>>{oysters_per_hour} oysters in 1 hour
If he can shuck {oysters_per_hour} oysters in 1 hour, so for {target_hours} hours in can shuck {target_hours}*{oysters_per_hour} = {total_oysters_shucked} oysters
